item.title: MIT-Educated Brothers Could Spend Decades in Prison for $25 Million Ethereum Scheme
item.description:
Manhattan court has opened the trial of two brothers accused of a $25M ethereum exploit; prosecutors have alleged fraud completed in 12 seconds, while the defense has argued the exploit was legal. The defense has sought to exclude Google search-history evidence; each faces up to 20 years per count.

The post MIT-Educated Brothers Could Spend Decades in Prison for $25 Million Ethereum Scheme appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Mesa Gallium3D Driver Merged For Arm Ethos NPUs
item.description: Arm has been working on an open-source Linux kernel accelerator "accel" driver for their Ethos NPUs. That kernel driver continues being revised and under review for inclusion into a future mainline Linux kernel release. Already though a Gallium3D driver for Mesa has been merged for leveraging the Ethos NPU...
